intro: Hieracium heterospermum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are yellow and bloom from June to September, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium heterospermum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can spread through rhizomes and seeds.
